request_pathways.name: Authorization to Release Health Information (fillable PDF)
Mail completed form to Health Information Management Department
Fax completed form (fax number not specified on form)

access_pathway.primary_pathway_description: Patients must use a general-purpose Authorization to Release Health Information form, listing themselves as the recipient, to request their own records.

red_flags: 90-day hard expiration with no option for custom date may expire before request is fulfilled
Ambiguous witness line — unclear whether witness signature is required or optional
Outdated legacy form (form-2) still publicly accessible, risking patient confusion
No submission method specified on the form
bright_spots: 59 fillable interactive fields — exceptional digital-first form design
Granular record-type selection with ~14 categories and individual date ranges
Individual sensitive-information consent via initials for six categories
Actively maintained form (January 2025 update, form code SM00081 10/24)
Clear right-to-refuse language with no consent bundling

findability.rationale: Level 4: Forms found on first web search attempt with direct PDF links — easy with basic search — but old form still accessible without redirect creates minor confusion.

technical_accessibility.rationale: Level 4: Mostly digital workflow — 59 fillable fields allow full electronic completion, but submission requires printing/faxing/mailing (one gap in the digital chain).

content_design.rationale: Level 4: Well-organized 2-page form with logical flow and clear section structure, but some legalistic language in sensitive information sections and no introductory guidance for patients.

patient_centeredness.rationale: Level 3: A patient can use the form but it wasn't designed for them — they must figure out to list themselves as recipient, select 'Personal' purpose, and navigate a third-party release structure with no Right of Access reference.

compliance.rationale: Level 4: Minor ambiguities (witness line unclear, no fee disclosure, 90-day hard expiration) but nothing that would materially impede a patient or misrepresent their rights; right to refuse and revoke clearly stated.

overall.summary: Sturdy Memorial delivers a technically excellent fillable form with granular record selection, but funnels patient self-access through a generic third-party release authorization without a dedicated pathway or Right of Access acknowledgment.
